content.text: A set is an unordered collection of unique, hashable values. Sets are perfect when you need to remove duplicates or check for membership quickly.

items: Use curly braces `{}` to declare a set, or call `set()` on an iterable.
Membership checks such as `value in my_set` are O(1) on average.
Create an empty set using `set()` (not `{}` which creates a dict).
Practice converting a list with duplicates into a set to deduplicate values.
Use `len()` on a set to count unique entries.

content.text: Python exposes mathematical set operations that allow you to combine, compare, and subtract collections of unique values.

hints: Look for the operation that keeps only shared values.
You can use either the method call or the operator syntax.
